name: axios
text:
JUST IN: President Trump has said he's postponing the G7 to September and will invite Russia, South Korea, Australia and India to the summit
https://t.co/PHthHdr9FI

name: axios
text:
NEW: Major U.S. cities have implemented curfews and called on National Guard to mobilize as thousands of protesters gather across the nation to continue protesting the death of George Floyd
https://t.co/PHthHdr9FI

name: axios
text:
NEW: Major U.S. cities have implemented curfews and called on National Guard to mobilize as thousands of protesters gather across the nation to continue protesting the death of George Floyd 
https://t.co/kT1Kic9giT

name: axios
text:
NEW: People around the world are turning out to show their support for U.S. protesters over the police killing of George Floyd — mainly rallying in front of American embassies
https://t.co/RzdmwMBY5Q

name: axios
text:
JUST IN: Police have fired tear gas during a fourth straight night of protests in Minneapolis, as demonstrations over the death of George Floyd and other police-related killings of black men spreads across the U.S.
https://t.co/42DGPE95dY

name: axios
text:
Dozens of journalists across the U.S. have shared videos of themselves and their crews getting arrested, being shot at by police with rubber bullets, targeted with tear gas by authorities or assaulted by protestors 
https://t.co/5dkb9acfnU

name: axios
text:
The response of some officers during demonstrations against police brutality in the U.S. has been criticized for being excessive by some officials and Black Lives Matter groups
https://t.co/Od3koFGLzZ

name: axios
text:
NEW: AOC has blasted New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio for defending the NYPD after video showed police officers driving their cars into a group of protesters, calling his comments "unacceptable" 
https://t.co/vSpJDRClL2

name: axios
text: NEW: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency, as the state became the latest to activate the National Guard. Here's what else has been happening at protests around the U.S. https://t.co/42DGPE95dY

name: axios
text: RT @marklittlenews: The latest round-up of attacks on the media during US protests https://t.co/X3meJozpDm

name: axios
text: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms: “If you were out protesting last night, you probably need to go get a COVID test this week.” https://t.co/CiAFnTB2ZF

name: axios
text:
WATCH: An unnamed 24-year-old protestor condemns "opportunistic" rioters in viral moment on CNN:

"If you cannot stand up and fight the good fight, and you want to be a cheater and go ahead and take what we're trying to do, something is wrong with you." https://t.co/Jj7WJ78ewa

name: axios
text: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms on Trump's response to protests: "This is like Charlottesville all over again. He speaks and he makes it worse. There are times when you should just be quiet." https://t.co/WASW5g3sah

name: axios
text: She continued: "Or if he can't be silent, if there is somebody of good sense and good conscience in the White House, put him in front of a teleprompter and pray that he reads it and at least says the right things, because he is making it worse." https://t.co/WASW5g3sah

name: axios
text: RT @StefWKight: It's not just the killing of George Floyd or the deaths of Breonna Taylor & Ahmaud Arbery. Or the demeaning of birdwatcher Christian Cooper & journalist Omar Jimenez. Or the coronavirus’s disproportionate harm to black Americans. It's all happening at once https://t.co/PepvuDLXbB

name: axios
text: White House national security adviser Robert O'Brien said on CNN that he doesn't believe there is "systemic racism" among law enforcement in the U.S., arguing that there's "a few bad apples" that are giving police a bad name. https://t.co/t4vkQ6UKJb

name: axios
text: RT @sarafischer: Many of these incidents, because they target the press, were captured live on camera. The footage could help to verify unnecessary police action against journalists. https://t.co/qgXdOHw5Qz

name: axios
text: JUST IN: SpaceX's Crew Dragon has safely delivered two NASA astronauts — Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken — to the International Space Station. https://t.co/WLZnEVrTLG

name: axios
text: Scoop: President Trump and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg spoke by phone on Friday. https://t.co/u8xzTUJT9U

name: axios
text: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser: "I think the president has a responsibility to calm the nation and he can start by not sending divisive tweets that are meant to hearken to the segregationist past of our country." https://t.co/IINJrhiH81

name: axios
text: RT @AlexSanz: The photos of protests around the country following the death of George Floyd during an encounter with Minneapolis police are hauntingly familiar. We’ve seen them many times before, going back decades. https://t.co/Dxv4qjutrZ

name: axios
text: NEW: Attorney General Bill Barr says the DOJ will use its network of 56 regional FBI Joint Terrorism Task Forces to identify the "criminal organizers and instigators" of violence during the George Floyd protests, including antifa. https://t.co/FMm91U5FQb

name: axios
text:
Trump tweeted earlier that the U.S. would designate antifa as a terrorist organization.

However, the law only allows foreign entities to be designated as terrorist groups, and antifa is a decentralized movement with no clear leadership. https://t.co/FMm91U5FQb

name: axios
text: Gov. Andrew Cuomo says he has asked the state's attorney general to review the New York Police Department's conduct during protests over the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/aqm3gED5P1

name: axios
text: "Terrorism is an inherently political label, easily abused and misused," the ACLU tweeted. "There is no legal authority for designating a domestic group. Any such designation would raise significant due process and First Amendment concerns." https://t.co/FMm91U5FQb
